body_html:
@elvinpoon I answered to your question on StackOverflow, on the missing "as" issue.

The last error, the "no such package" thing seems to be a new thing that has been introduced recently: you can only build once after configuring. If you run into errors, you have to actually repeat the configure step and the build again. I don't quite know why.

In case you don't want to go through the trouble, here's my last TF build for my machine:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1414175/tf/tensorflow_gpu_cuda8_cdnn5.1-0.10.0rc0-6d04d60-py3-none-any.whl

To install, you have to rename it (or symlink) to tensorflow-0.10.0rc0-py3-none-any.whl, otherwise pip installation will fail.

It's a few days old, but still more or less up to date.

It's a few days old, but still more or less up to date.
body:
@elvinpoon I answered to your question on StackOverflow, on the missing "as" issue.

The last error, the "no such package" thing seems to be a new thing that has been introduced recently: you can only build _once_ after configuring. If you run into errors, you have to actually repeat the configure step and the build again. I don't quite know why.

In case you don't want to go through the trouble, here's my last TF build for my machine:

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1414175/tf/tensorflow_gpu_cuda8_cdnn5.1-0.10.0rc0-6d04d60-py3-none-any.whl

To install, you have to rename it (or symlink) to `tensorflow-0.10.0rc0-py3-none-any.whl`, otherwise pip installation will fail.

It's a few days old, but still more or less up to date.
